bioghist.p: Reverend John Mark Irwin (1899 -1997) and Ruth Hoffman Irwin (1900-1982) were appointed to the Persia (Iran) Mission in 1932 by the Board of Foreign Missions of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.. Until their retirement in 1965, they served primarily as evangelists at various locations in Iran, including Meshed, Hamadan, Teheran, and Sari, as well as in Kabul, Afghanistan.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to the Irwins' missionary work in Iran. Materials include typed notes for sermons, lessons for bible study, and programs for services; manuscript articles by J. Mark Irwin on foreign missions, church leadership in Iran, evangelism in Iran, and other topics; a small amount of correspondence, some of it dealing with financial matters; a photocopy of "Who's who in the Iran Mission" from 1963; and a small volume belonging to L. F. Esselstyn noting names of missionaries working in Iran in the late 19th and early 20th century, along with their dates of arrival in the country and their birth and death dates. Some materials are in Persian.
